bug.author: YuchenWang
bug.description:
I install it in Mac OS with python3,PyQt5 Let's take in video annotation in video When I start labelme at first, it all works correct. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15023991/55431229-04f59180-555e-11e9-8ddf-4bffb72dad1c.png></denchmark-link>
But after I click next image, then it will duplicate the polygon. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15023991/55431483-aa106a00-555e-11e9-9aac-1d61c76c227d.png></denchmark-link>
If I save the label in this time, it will save 6 polygon which double the original polygon. If I I try to del the duplicate polygon before save, it will cause error and quit the program ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list.

comments.comment: Thanks for the report. I will check it.
I saw this case was closed. But I just update the new version and it seems that this problem still existed?
First of all, I would say the duplicate label is expected behavior when you use --keep-prev. What I fixed is making it deletable.

Yes, I retry it again and also if I try to delete the duplicate label, it still give the same error. (I check my labelme --version, it is labelme 3.11.2, I hope it is the correct version which you fixed)

Great, now I may remove the duplicate label correctly. Thanks for your quick response. But I still hope this kind of duplicate label could be solved, so it will not copy the label when the image move backward.
Yeah, it seems reasonable to not copying to already labeled image. Could you open an issue for that?
Sure, I will open a new issue.
